Class HTMLBrowser

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component

All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, IHTMLListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, IPanel, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AboutPanel, HelloWorldPanel, Test
public class HTMLBrowser
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements IPanel, IHTMLListener

A HTMLPane with a 'Home' and 'Back' button.

Christoph Schwering (schwering@gmail.com)

Constructor Detail

HTMLBrowser

public HTMLBrowser(java.lang.String resource)
Creates a new HTMLBrowser.

Parameters:
resource - The resource which should be displayed. This means it must be contained in the JAR which also contains the HTMLPane (i.e. not in a seperate module).

HTMLBrowser

public HTMLBrowser(java.lang.Class cls,
                   java.lang.String resource)
Creates a new HTML frame with the content of a resource.

Parameters:
cls - The class whose classloader is used to access the resource.
resource - The resource which should be displayed. This means it must be contained in the JAR which cls.

HTMLBrowser

public HTMLBrowser(java.net.URL url)
Creates a new HTMLBrowser.

Parameters:
url - The URL whose content should be displayed.
Method Detail

siteChanged

public void siteChanged(java.net.URL url)
Description copied from interface: IHTMLListener
Fired when a new website is loaded. Currently, this event is fired when either a frame's or the whole window's content changes. This event is not fired when the initial page is loaded!

Specified by:
siteChanged in interface IHTMLListener
Parameters:
url - The new site.

dispose

public void dispose()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Should clean up used resources when the panel is shut down.
This method is also declared in IModule (IModule.dispose()). This makes it easy to write a graphical module that implements both. See the weird explanations at the top.

Specified by:
dispose in interface IPanel
See Also:
IModule.dispose()

getIcon

public javax.swing.Icon getIcon()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Returns the panel's icon. If the panel should have no icon, this method must return null.

Specified by:
getIcon in interface IPanel
Returns:
The panel's icon or null.
See Also:
ImageIcon

getPanelInstance

public java.awt.Component getPanelInstance()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Returns a reference to the module instance's GUI part as Component. Each invokation of getPanelInstance must return a reference to the same object. This means that this method must not create a new panel but return just a reference to a once created panel.

If the implementing module extends java.awt.Component (e.g. if it extends javax.swing.JPanel) this method simply might return this.

Specified by:
getPanelInstance in interface IPanel
Returns:
The concrete GUI-part as java.awt.Component.

getTitle

public java.lang.String getTitle()
Description copied from interface: IPanel
Returns the panel's title. The title is to be used in the tabbar.

Specified by:
getTitle in interface IPanel
Returns:
The title.
